Legal_Issue: Whether the appellant meets the residency requirement for Canadian citizenship under Section 5(1) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Appellant spent 1,063 days outside Canada during the four-year period preceding the application; absences were voluntary and business-related; maintained ties in Canada
Court_Ruling: Appellant does not meet the residency requirement due to excessive voluntary absences
Defendant_Behavior: Voluntary prolonged absences from Canada for business purposes
Grounds_for_Claim: Dispute over interpretation and application of residency requirements
Legal_Standard: Applicant must have at least three years (1,095 days) of physical residence in Canada within the four years preceding the application
Assessment_Factor: Duration and nature of absences, maintenance of residential ties in Canada
Procedural_Issue: Appeal heard in Vancouver with new evidence presented after initial decision by Citizenship judge
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied in administrative appeal
Evidence_Used: Records of travel, employment details abroad, proof of maintained ties in Canada
Application_Basis: Residency calculation based on days physically present in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Travel history, duration of stays outside Canada, connection to Canadian community
Governing_Rule: Residence must be accumulated in Canada; absences must not indicate abandonment of residence
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to demonstrate sufficient physical presence in Canada despite maintained ties
Outcome: Appeal dismissed; appellant must spend more time in Canada to qualify
Cause_Description: Appellant's application for citizenship was denied due to insufficient residency in Canada
Evidence_Handling: New evidence presented on appeal but did not establish compliance with residency rule
Residency_Compliance: Not met â€“ 1,063 days outside Canada exceeds allowable absence limit
Evidence_Assessment: Absences deemed voluntary and substantial, outweighing maintained residential ties
Decision_Rationale: Extended voluntary absences break continuity of residence required by law
Legal_Standard_Applied: Interpretation of 'residence' under the Citizenship Act requiring physical presence
